website_summaries.verdict: A simple, no-frills cable modem solution that provides authentically fast internet speeds at a great price.
pros: Gigabit Ethernet port for superior speed when devices are directly plugged in
Built-in lightning and power surge protection
cons: There are speedier cable modems available from Motorola

website_summaries.verdict: Fast and future-proof with automated setup and smooth integration with Comcast’s systems.
pros: Sets up easily and interfaces automatically with the provider
Runs reliably with few drops over a several-month period
Easily achieves download speeds of 250 to 300 Mbps with room to grow
cons: Does not have telephony features built in, which may cause compatibility issues with a bundled voice plan
Modem can fail after several months of use

customer_reviews.title: It just works sooo good!
customer_reviews.text: Oh Man! What a difference! After fighting with the POS Xfinity modem/router/WiFi/telephone box for years, I've come to my senses and gotten rid of all it. No more random re-boots. No more loosing all my settings and preferences every few weeks. No more not being able to communicate between devices on my LAN. No more having my modem/router being hacked and hijacked because it's so riddled with vulnerabilities. Now I have a really good, dedicated modem with the power to do the job it was meant to do! I'm really loving this thing, it's so small, and it just works sooo good!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had much difficulty with the installation, but as it turns out, I had it right all along. My problem was that I did not wait for my router (Airport Express) to sync with the modem after installing. I'm so glad that I will not be paying Comcast anymore for modem rental. I should have purchased my own modem years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Consistent loss of internet
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem would not work for me. Im not sure if it is defective or what. Every time I would try and do anything the internet would stop working. I logged into the modem and kept seeing the same errors persisting (I have posted the errors in a screenshot for you to compare). I swapped it out with an Arris SB6183 modem and haven't had any problems since. So it had to be the Motorola cable modem that was causing the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Leach

customer_reviews.title: Won't last...or will it..(update)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this modem over a year now and it gave out. This is a decent modem but I expected it to last at least 3-5 years. Not the case here, I'm restarting it multiple times a day b/c it keeps restarting itself and the internet speed is super slow. Update: so after constantly restarting my modem, it turns out the cable wire coming from the outside pole to the house was damaged. Comcast came out and tested the wire and replaced it. Now everything works great. I changed my review from 1 to 5 stars since the modem was fine all along. it was my cable company telling me different!
customer_reviews.author: MartyMar

customer_reviews.title: Mac address doesn't register on the network. Also overheats badly.
customer_reviews.text: RCN keeps telling me that the modem is still showing that this mac address is not registering on the network. The first modem wasn't new when arrived. This one was a sealed package but I wonder if it was being used already. Also, it heats up badly in the summer. Connection keeps dropping constantly.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy as expected and once Comcast completed their activation it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to use with my Comcast xFinity service. I originally leased their modem because at the time I wanted home phone and didn't have a cable modem with that jack. Setup was easy as expected and once Comcast completed their activation it was up and running. I am on the 100 Mbps plan and the leased modem would typically return about 120 Mbps with speed tests. This modem also results in about 120 Mbps. Happy to not be paying Comcast for the monthly lease!
customer_reviews.author: CFPhelps

customer_reviews.title: A Brand I Trust
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Motorola modem that had to be about 19 years old. During the Covid-19 pandemic, that old DOCSIS 2.0 modem was a severe bottleneck with everyone in my neighborhood working from home. Since the old Motorola lasted 19 years, I figured I'd replace it with another unit of the same brand. Comcast's support in setting up the unit was lacking. I had to wait on hold for about 40 minutes to talk with someone. However, when has Comcast provided good support? Never. This was not the fault of this unit. Once this modem was setup, my internet has been faster and more reliable than ever!
customer_reviews.author: TheLasko

customer_reviews.title: Beware on Optimum
customer_reviews.text: Ignore all the people using this modem on Optimum online. As of 7/3/2020, this modem is not compatible with Optimum Online. Tech support cannot input the MAC in the input box, so it means it is not compatible. Fair warning, I bought the 8x4 model and used it onl Infinity's network earlier this year without issue. That model worked great, so I assume this would have been fine, if Optimum Online let it. Sorry, not a review on Motorola. I'm just pissed as I have been a OOL customer for 20 years, and they have gone downhill in a big way. Tech support wanted to charge me $80 to come my house to check it out.
customer_reviews.author: SteveI

customer_reviews.title: All in all Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: this item arrived today. I just (a few hours ago) plugged it in. The modem itself seems fine. The hour + I spent on the phone with Comcast sucked! Why is it every time you call the cable/internet provider they try to sell you something?! My problem stemmed from having to register my modem, since it is not a Comcast one they will need to set it up. My having been on the phone that long was a security issue not the registration. The registration took like 5 minutes. For the easy with that I applaud Motorola. At this point I say this is a good buy and I am glad to be online again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron N. Plumb

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cable Modem.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice cable modem. I was told by a friend that I should buy my own cable modem and not use the one from Comcast. So I purchased this one and waited for Comcast to arrive. The installer laughed when he saw it. Ok I was thinking is that a good laugh. He said you have the rolls royce of Cable Modems here. This is definitely a great modem. Then he said you pair this with the google wifi system you have and you will have a great overall setup. I took that as a great sign. Seems to work great. No problems with it. Setup was easy peasy lemon squeezey.
customer_reviews.author: The Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: No go
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 year old router modem combo from my provider and wanted to stop the monthly fee and buy my own modem, having my own router already. While this was easy enough to set up, for the life of me the Nintendo Switch could not connect to it. The router blames the modem and the modem blames the router. Tried numerous things with Nintendo help to try to configure this thing properly to no avail. In the end I returned
customer_reviews.author: Knope2020

customer_reviews.title: Nice boost in speed
customer_reviews.text: My cable company notified me that my previous modem was no longer supported and recommended that I upgrade to support the higher speeds. I previously had a Motorola so I stuck with the same brand and bought this upgraded model. Comcast/xfinity had recently upped my internet speed from 50Mbs to 100Mbs. My old modem struggled to keep up. I don't know why, but after installing this modem I am getting data rates exceeding 170Mbs. I am thrilled but puzzled why I am getting more speed than my ISP is providing. Anyway, I had this modem up and running in about five minutes and I am very happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Cook

customer_reviews.title: Not Optimum/cablevision friendly
customer_reviews.text: I called Optimum to set up this modem and they said it was not compatible. I'm not sure why others here say they work together. This is an email I received from Motorola "The reason being is that Optimum unfortunately took all of our modem off of there approved modems listings. This was a decision that was made on there end despite our protests not to do it. There have been people using our modems who had them for Internet and the modems worked until Optimum decided to do this. We do apologized for the inconvenience."
customer_reviews.author: Chris Collucci

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Fast
customer_reviews.text: We have comcast xfinity internet. We upgraded out speed because 25 mp was extremely slow. We upgraded to 125 and it did not make a difference. We bought this modem and instantly our Internet speed in the speed test went up to 130. This modem does not come with wifi. You have to buy a router. Definitely recommend this product especially if you stream videos.
customer_reviews.author: kjnqueen

customer_reviews.title: NOT THAT COMPATIBLE !
customer_reviews.text: If you are running the newest OS X "High Sierra". OS X 10.13.0 through 10.13.3 then you will realize that the "System Preferences" for "Networks" no longer contains the "Assist Me" link, and believe me this modem really needs for most of us to utilize this helper subroutine in order to make this modem work; especially if your computer has previously been hooked up to a different modem AND in my case you are using Comcast. The Comcast "Speed Test" is designed to work over iPV4 and this is an iPV6 modem. However, the Motorola MB8600 works on iPV4 and iPV6 and Docsis3.0 and Docsis 3.1 . . .
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Love

customer_reviews.title: Buy Your Own Rather Than Renting from Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Don't give Comcast any more money than necessary. They will give you a list of acceptable modems. No. Just no. Their choices are subpar and expensive. I saved so much with simple research here on Amazon. I instantly saw an increased speed as soon as hooked it up. THE HOOKUP Very important: Make sure you have your service account number Unplug the old modem Plug in the new modem When your smartphone, tablet, or computer prompts you, put in the service info. Done.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Called support Motorola support they said call Comcast support which told me they do not support it got the runaround so just returned it
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Works with Grande Communications 300Mbs Service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a Linksys CM3024 that had either a) gone bad, or b) had been hacked and slowed. See Intel Puma chipset vulnerability for details. Was experiencing poor connectivity and slow data transfer, with the Linksys modem repeatedly exhibiting momentary drop out of multi-channel downstream bonding. Installed the Motorola modem, called Grande to get it registered and recognized, the modem connected and immediately gave a solid, fast connection to ISP. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my WOW cable modem perfectly = monthly savings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my WOW (wide open west) cable rental modem. I have the 500mbs package and it was very easy to setup. Simply screw in the cable line and plug this into my router with an ethernet cord. Called WOW tech support and gave them the MAC ID on the bottom of this modem and I was up and running 30 seconds later. Saves me about $7 a month off my cable bill!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Equal Playing field.
customer_reviews.text: This makes a world of difference if you were having problems with any call of duty games. Especially on Blackout Call of Duty. Night and day difference. Bullets register consistently. Edit: This helped me immensely in Call of Duty. The bullet reg was spot on. IMPORTANT NOTE: Moca Support: Not included This works best if your broadcast tv networks are not broadcasted of Moca(internet-over-coaxial).
customer_reviews.author: R. Stallworth

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain for fantastic speeds -- no need to call Comcast to install
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason I am writing this review is to clarify that you do NOT need to call Comcast (Xfinity) to install the device. I plugged it in and waited about 2 minutes before the lights went solid. Opened up Chrome and tried to go to Google and was redirected to the Comcast setup page. I had to authenticate by text message. You also need to provide your street address for the installation. After the I finished setting it up on Comcast's website, it took about 5 minutes before internet went live. On another positive note, I am now getting 30 Mbps more than my previous Motorola modem. Great price, easy to install, extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Started flaking out after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, then started disconnecting randomly after 6 months. Had to do a couple hard resets which worked for a while, then finally gave up and bought a different one. I'll see if their warranty is any good.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, but gives off some serious heat and light
customer_reviews.text: Solid performer in a small package. I pay for a 150 / 25 Mbps connection. Upon plugging this modem in and activating it, I immediately got 153 / 23 on my first Speedtest run; the modem works as advertised. She runs warm, and the LEDs are quite bright. Make sure to place this modem in an open space so that it can breathe, and somewhere that the light from the LEDs won't distract or bother you. If it had a dark mode for the LEDs, I'd have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jay D.

customer_reviews.title: Has worked perfectly since day 1.  Never have to reset.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked flawlessly for me since I purchased it. I can't say that's much faster than the old 4x4 modem I had, but it's certainly not any slower. Technically, this device did shave about 2ms off my ping average. As this difference has been consistent, I suppose I can say that it is faster... but 2ms is pretty minimal. On the plus side, it has opened me up to the faster broadband packages if I want to sell Comcast my kidney for ultra high-speed internet. :)
customer_reviews.author: waterguy

customer_reviews.title: Top notch stability
customer_reviews.text: I'm in IT so I've evaluated many many a cable modem. This is a meat and potatos cable modem. Does what you need it to do. ZERO problems with this model, unlike some previous cable modems I've owned. Hardware reset button is a MUST
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Like it. Small but functional.
customer_reviews.text: Connected to Xfinity in a minute or two. Super easy. It's smaller than I expected, almost fits in your palm. Nice! The one odd thing - the power block is black (got it the white item for a reason, dah) I do understand that routers break right after the warranty expires. So this review is some 10 months early. I will update if and when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: vitya

customer_reviews.title: It's Simple, Do It!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Should of done this a lot sooner. Comcast charging $11 dollars a month. Simple directions, it took 10 minutes to set up. The actual set up was hooking my laptop with the modem with the provided ethernet cable, pulling up the comcast web page, and putting in the Comcast account number. I returned the modem to Comcast store, they asked for the modem serial number at the store, and all is good. Simple, it works fine, kids playing video games with internet friends, Netflix, Apple TV, Ooma, all working fine, and will pay for itself in 6 months. No hassle from Comcast, which was shocking!
customer_reviews.author: Geralyn S.

customer_reviews.title: A Motorola MB7420 review Apr 2018.  Easy install & greater speed!
customer_reviews.text: This new Motorola Modem MB7420 really did install itself, just as represented and reviewed by many others. I simply plugged it in as instructed and waited. Be patient, as I was on the phone with Comcast as they reported seeing the new modem register and it was done that easy! And yes, the Docsis 3.0 has a significant improvement in speed over Docsis 2. We replaced the older Surfboard model # SB6121 and are pleased indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Azoomer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast delivery after Comcast could not install my end of life modem.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this at noon on the day Comcast installers refused to install my old modem that was removed working when Comcast account cancelled at a different house 2 months ago. Amazon prime delivered it 24 hours later, the driver ringing doorbell and waiting until I opened door... WOW! It installed incredibly easily, using a computer attached to the cat 5 output as instructions described, and works fine with my old router to stream youtube tv. I'm very happy with the modem, the price, the vendor and Amazon prime. 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Works fine once cable-provider cooperates
customer_reviews.text: Setup was delayed due to cable provider not understanding what they were being told. Since this was cleared-up, things have worked fine. Two things to note: 1) the upper LED (called Amber in the manual) appears Red and flashes with an active WAN connection. This is normal but it might appear to many that a flashing red light indicates some problem. 2) Tech-types will find this modem has a pretty good Control-Panel, accessed through browser IP like a router. Each of the 16 channels has a realtime activity graph within the cont'l panel.
customer_reviews.author: Malinger Now

customer_reviews.title: Made in Vietnam
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a decent price. It's a plug and play. I was prompted by the internet browser to activate. I did not have to call Xfinity as I had my own modem before. This was a simple swap. I did have to restart the modem a couple times after initial activation but everything is running smoothly now. I'm getting 230-240mbps for download speed with a latency of 15-18, and an upload speed of 12mbps. (Used several different speed test websites) It came with a Cat 6 ethernet cable, but I already had a Cat 7.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K.

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about 2 months, then started "spotting". ;-) It would just drop constantly some days, and then work for a little while, then drop and reboot about every 3 minutes. I thought it was the internet, but after troubleshooting, finally swapped this out with another modem and everything is back on par to being normal. "Just outside of product support". yeah.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barbret

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Great Signal
customer_reviews.text: I had a modem/router through the cable company and I was having dropped service frequently it would seem as the modem would just reset or take a break (that's what it seemed like). This had great reviews, was on sale, so Decided to purchase. It was so easy to set up and I had it running within 10 minutes. I use my Apple Airport Extreme with the modem and I have had no drops, that I am aware of, to this point. Since I stream my TV services, this is an improvement. Not only that, but I also save myself $10 per month and this will pay for itself within 6 months. Great item and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Canter

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I left my wife one morning with a hastily drawn picture of how I wanted the wires routed, and this modem sitting in the box on the table. The installer came out and spent all of 20 minutes installing the run, hooking up the modem, and testing it. Later I came home, plugged in the router, and configured it, and was streaming within 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: big daddy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install- works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a cable company owned one. It was easy to install. Since it wasn't on the list of the cable company's "approved" modems, we simply had to call in the S/N to activate. It seems to be working very well. In fact it MAY have fixed the dropped connections we were having. Will know soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: L from Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Daily connection issues, Less than a year old
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem just under a year ago and it is showing signs of stability issues. I have to reset the modem almost every day. Sometimes I have to reset it multiple times in hopes it picks up the connection. Throughout its life span when it worked, it would randomly go out too. It's easy to setup and works great when it does work, but it dying in under a year is a one star product. The router, network itself, cables, and everything were all troubleshooted but the modem was the cause.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, solid price point. Stop renting a modem from your cable provider!
customer_reviews.text: Crazy easy setup, super compact, boots lightning fast. Time will tell on overall quality, but Motorola products don't usually fail me. I'll try to update after more long term use. In terms of economy, at the current listed Amazon price this modem pays for itself after 7 months, since I'll no longer be paying a $10/mo rental fee to Comcast for a much older device. Note the other reviews if you are completely tech illiterate, I haven't needed to call my provider tech support but some say they aren't as helpful when you're not using their hardware, which makes some sense.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Suddenlink.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Super easy install. I'm using it with suddenlink and I just had to call them, provide the number on the bottom, and have them send the activation signal. It took less than ten minutes. It also has a handy on/off switch on the back if you prefer to only have your internet on when your home. Signal strength is fantastic and my speed test is actually higher than I'm supposed to be getting both when directly connected, and via the wifi from my router (not included if course).
customer_reviews.author: Cryss

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Connected on COX. I replaced my older modem Cisco DPC3010 because it was running too hot, but this MB7420 doesn't seem to be much cooler. It feels quite hot to the touch on the top of the modem. A thermometer on top measures over 104 F, with my room temperature of 72 F, not sure if that is what I should expect Running for over a week now without any problem, 16channels bound on downstream and 4 channels on upstream. Unfortunately COX is limiting my speed to 50Mb even if they charge a rip off price of 70$ a month for the internet service.
customer_reviews.author: F. G.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately Not Compatible with Charter Spectrum in Wisconsin
customer_reviews.text: In a way I feel that this it not Motorola's fault. This modem has great build quality. It's also on the list of "Recommended Modems" in the "Authorized Devices on the Spectrum Network". Unfortunately after several attempts Charter could not activate this modem. I tried resetting it using the reset button to no avail. I was very sad to have to return it. I ended up getting an Arris SB6183 instead, which did activate no problem.
customer_reviews.author: YChilds

customer_reviews.title: Good Stable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I got it for Comcast 100Mbps service and I got 119/5.85Mbps out of it. It is very easy to setup. It is a bit overkill for 100Mbps service but I want the extra capacity in case I upgrade my service in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MWong

customer_reviews.title: Good Modem for 3-Person Household
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. I just followed the instructions, called my service provider to activate the equipment then ready to go! I was “renting” a modem from Spectrum at $10/month for years. For my 2020 resolution, I was resolved in finding ways to cut spending and it turns out this is an easy way. Only $60 one time purchase and I’ll save $60 this year and $120 next year. I’m hoping it will last me around 4 years. So far I’m happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device from Motorola
customer_reviews.text: I am a super-techie of many decades - and this Motorola MB7420 modem is about the most perfect technical device I’ve ever seen. I bought one almost a year ago, plugged it in, turned it on, called the cable ISP (Spectrum) to activate it - and it has been running faultlessly, with no intervention whatsoever, ever since. It’s in a space where it sometimes gets very hot - and remains completely unbothered. Its performance is in many key respects far beyond the rental modem it replaced, despite their having pretty much identical spec’s. Truly awesome, especially for the price. The ultimate 5-star product.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, plug and play. Fine unless you're getting a gigibit connection
customer_reviews.text: Note that this is a modem only, so no wifi. We have a 100mpbs connection and it works perfectly fine for us--just plugged it in and had internet almost immediately. The modem is small and came with a coaxial cable (no ethernet). We bought through Amazon warehouse, but looking at the modem, you wouldn't know it came used. This is an older modem, so it doesn't support gigabit connections, but for most home uses it will be perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wrenhaven

customer_reviews.title: Easiest in all ever
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old surfboard that decided to go belly up. Read over many reviews and the ease of installation is what convinced me to try it. What a great decision. This was the easiest set up I have ever done. Unplugged my old one from the cable and power. Hooked up this new one and unless than 5 minutes all lights were on that should have been. Got my code for xfinity and entered it as asked and with in less than 10 minutes I was up and running. This thing took me from about 30mbps to 78mbps. What a great difference. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a new modem.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Corum

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding High-speed Compact Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded our Internet service from 50Mb/s to 300MB/s download but we never noticed any improvement in speed. After talking with a friend, we discovered that my extant cable modem couldn't handle speeds faster than 50Mb/s. After hunting around, I selected this modem because it offers speeds twice what the current maximum is (300Mb/s) and it's very compact. Our experience shows that it starts up very quickly, recovers automatically from Internet service provide failures, and it has a power switch(!). I never though the power switch would be important, but I really like that feature and it has proven to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Diemer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for 2 months now with Cox internet and it has been very reliable. We get internet speeds faster than what we are paying for. Note that this device does not provide WiFi, you need a separate wireless router. I recommend the TP Link Archer A7 router to go with this. It has also been very reliable (I have had issues with other routers in the past with reliability).
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Salesky

customer_reviews.title: DOCSIS 3.0 only, may be field-upgradeable, depending on your provider
customer_reviews.text: Comcast is already rolling out DOCSIS 3.1, so check with your local provider before buying. best feature: the convenient power button, for when you call Comcast to tell them your cable service is out along with your neighbors' - it makes it easy to reset your modem. <_<
customer_reviews.author: Yet Another Gomez Addams

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading to this modem, my speeds are way faster than my 2013 modem that it replaced. I still think it's a scam that one needs to buy a new modem when the one you have works perfectly but I have indeed noticed a speed increase so there's that. This one isn't as bright as my old one so the lights don't bother me at night and I refuse to lease one from Comcast. It took probably 10 minutes to setup . Very good investment so far.
customer_reviews.author: Clayfreak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I bought it after seeing positive reviews on Amazon. Could not be happier, with this modem and the Apple Extreme router, I feel the network is very fast. One thing: when you supply your own router, you have to call your internet provider and read them the numbers on the bottom of the unit so they can make sure they can talk to it. . .
customer_reviews.author: jbdind

customer_reviews.title: Great basic Cable Modem that will save you bucks.
customer_reviews.text: Not the latest and fastest so check the specs whether its fast enough for you. I found it to be plenty fast for my service and a great price. The faster the modem, the more it costs and the longer it takes to pay back. Installs easily by automatically going out to the register site the first time you browse. Their registration servers can be busy at times so it might take a couple tries to get registers. It's not the modem, it's their servers.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Seibold

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for seven months including streaming HD TV. Then it quit working. The shortest life span of any modem I have owned. They advertise a two year warranty but you must ship it at your expense and risk. There will always be some percentage that fail but if you are serious about a two year warranty, why does the customer pay for shipping when it doesn't even last a year? That puts it at 2 stars for me.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Falied a few days into use
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a replacement of the same model that crashed in less than a month into regular use. The front panel Upload light goes off when the unit get hot to the touch, about an hour into running. Had to disconnect the power cord, wait a minute and reconnect. Got a replacement from Amazon.This unit has the same issue but now in less than a week in use. In addition, it suddenly disconnects from Internet. Called Spectrum and the bottom line is : PROBLEM IS THE MODEM . This was my second try with this model. And the last. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Wagner

customer_reviews.title: The reason for spotty service
customer_reviews.text: After several months of intermittent internet outages (after almost five years of near-perfect service with my previous modem) my ISP informed me today that the culprit is this modem. After scanning several reviews of this modem, it appears I'm not the only one. The modem will work for a half hour or so, then go down for the same interval, and come back up. It will work for several days and then... not. The indicator lights will not suggest anything is wrong. Nothing will change after several reboots. I've even tried multiple routers thinking that was the problem, but it wasn't. Sadly I am past the return period. I'm buying a new modem from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Eagan

customer_reviews.title: Used!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a used modem already on another person's Xfinity account. Tried to set up my cable and was unable to. Now must wait for Xfinity to sort out the issue. I would never have purchased if I had known this was used. False advertising. Extremely upset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great modem upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace a previous 2yo modem the motorola SB6121, which Comcast tech stated is obsolete and will no longer accept future updates. Upon receipt I hooked up all the connections and called Xfinity Tech support to have it activated. After a few hiccups with the tech support (very apparent with Comcast svcs) the modem seemed to run like a champ. All the signals lit up very fast and I logged into it to set up the security which was very simple. Hands down this modem is a great upgrade to have.
customer_reviews.author: Master Woo

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The modem does the modem thing and that's it. Very simple and straightforward. Well ventilated. Cons: It has a hard time remembering login sessions though, when you log into it to change settings. From one page to the next it might forget you logged in and require you to log in again. Other notes: Mine is hooked up to an Asus RT68U router. I hear cable modems run hot, so I bought a 120mm case fan and power supply combo, a DC power supply with molex connector, to blow air on it. That's forward thinking so I don't have to write a "modem fried" review.
customer_reviews.author: LSOJ

customer_reviews.title: Easiest setup I have ever done, works perfectly with comcast
customer_reviews.text: New Comcast (Xfinity) internet customer, hooked this up to my cable wire, computer and power, turned it on and booted computer, open my browser and in less then 5 minutes it is up and working, didn't even need to call Comcast, The modem & Comcast website did everything for setup on their own, easiest setup I have ever done. Will update review after I have used it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Great But...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good modem, but I have experienced some connectivity issues since I’ve had it. I don’t know if it is the modem itself or if it is an issue with my ISP. I don’t see any issues indicated by the status lights so I will assume it is with my ISP. If the issues arises again and I can confirm that it is indeed not an issue with the modem, I will change my rating to 5 stars. It offers pretty reliable connection and I no longer have to pay my cable company a rental fee. More money in my pocket so I will take that.
customer_reviews.author: Akiel Rhoden

customer_reviews.title: Good Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Upgrade for our previous Motorola cable modem, allowing our family to enjoy fully the new 200 Mbps service provided by our ISP. Installation was straightforward and accompanying instructions were simple, clear. In service to date, we've had to restart this modem quite a few times after finding the Upstream panel light indicating a loss of bond with multiple channels.
customer_reviews.author: Chummy

customer_reviews.title: Better DOCSIS 3 modem has 16 streams available for use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cable modem, just hook up your internet cable, plug in your router or your computer's networking cable and turn it on. Your ISP will automatically reassign the IP address to the new modem. See it from your router page or open the modem page (with a new login) You don't need to see it if its working. But its good to save your WAN IP information. Motorola has an 800 number if you need help.
customer_reviews.author: JohnG

customer_reviews.title: Received a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on October 11th. As of November 21st, the modem died. After resetting multiple times, pressing the on/off button multiple times, and plugging it into different outlets this will not power on. The lights don't come on. Chatting with Amazon customer support was a waste of time, I was advised they would get back to me but of course never did. They said they were supposedly contacting Motorola support, but that didn't happen either. This thing is junk. Thanks for wasting my time Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Buy vs. Lease, IMO Buy
customer_reviews.text: This modem is working as expected. I bought my previous Motorola modem from my cable service provider and after about 5 years it was not performing the to the my current cable service's speed. Since the old modem saved me money by operating well for 5 years, I decided to buy my own modem again. If this one lasts 5 years I'll have saved considerably by buying rather than renting. With the new modem my downloiad speed went from about 65 mbps to over 300 mbps and the upload went from 4+ to 20+.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel B. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Avoiding a Xfinity modem rental rental charge.
customer_reviews.text: 1) I wanted to avoid the monthly Xfinity rental for my internet service. 2) I Already have a very good 802.11ac POE wireless Unifi router. 3) I had an Ethernet routers from previous purchasers. 4) This modem was satisfactory for my needs, with no extra this modem doesn't provide a WiFi signal. I didn't require tech support So, this was a perfect modem for my needs. I'd purchase again for the same situation. I recommend for others with same needs.
customer_reviews.author: W. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: It works great! The Technicolor modem/router combo that was owned by ...
customer_reviews.text: Currently on 300/20 Time Warner Cable connection. It works great! The Technicolor modem/router combo that was owned by TWC was horrible, any heavy use and my connection would reset. Attached are speed test; I'm able to get very close to advertised speeds on Speedtest (server is located 60 miles) and SpeedOf.me (server is > 300 miles).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Yay, it worked. easy to set up. Connect your cable, connect your router, turn it on. Call your cable company and have them activate. Loads better than my old Spectrum Arris modem - more stable. It's a MODEM, not a router. It will not pump out wifi to your house without a router connected. I connected it to my Apple Time Capsule, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Net Tech

customer_reviews.title: Replaced an Arris
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is full blooded Motorola. It also has an on/off button AND an actual factory reset button!! The Arris didn't have either of those and it lasted about 2 years before it started dropping the signal. Will report back if and when it dies.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Piotrowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my previous Motorola Cable Modem, in operation since 2011, due to increased speeds from my internet provider which required constant rebooting. Going to the 16x4 Cable Modem coupled with a Medialink MLWR-AC1200R Wireless Gigabit Router doubled my internet speeds immediately. Easy Modem setup with required no phone calls to the service provider, just follow the directions provided.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: A Time Warner repair tech recommended purchasing an internet modem during a recent service repair
customer_reviews.text: A Time Warner repair tech recommended purchasing an internet modem during a recent service repair, which would save the $8/month lease charge. Set-up was fairly quick other than needing to reset my router to the factory defaults as the modem would not recognize it. But the results were awesome as my download speeds went from the low 20's to high 30's and uploads from low 2's to mid 6's. The speed improvement alone made this worth the price, but having it pay for itself in 10 months makes this a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My old Cisco modem was finally starting to get weird (full download speed at times with next to no upload speed, intermittent connection, lackluster speeds, micro-lag noticeable in games) and so I ordered this based on reviews and a solid Fakespot score (fix that, Netgear) and wasn't disappointed. Smooth sailing ever since, so far with my 200/20 service! Easy setup, and it's nice to have a push-button power switch in the back of the device like my modem has in case I ever need to reboot it.
customer_reviews.author: Electrika

customer_reviews.title: but it's been running for over a year now and still works fine as best i can tell
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to judge a modem's quality, but it's been running for over a year now and still works fine as best i can tell. I bought this when I realized I was paying $8 (soon to be $12) to the cable company for "leasing" their old modem. Wish I would have done this years ago. Money down the drain. This one seems to be working fine. I'm using it now to post this review.
customer_reviews.author: George Coghill

customer_reviews.title: Great value for an excellent modem!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16x4 cable modem, model MB7420 as a replacement for my older MOTOROLA modem (it was six years old)...the older modem ran every day/24/7 and was beginning to display electronic hiccups. The newer MB7420, yes there or even newer models on the market, but this model met all my home use needs and was a great value for the dollar. Easy to install. Works perfectly! MOTOROLA has done it again! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Easy Switch From DSL
customer_reviews.text: Cable modem was easy to install as I switched from DSL over to cable Internet service provided by Comcast/Xfinity. One issue the smart technology figured out for me was my old DSL modem assigned IP addresses for my home network while this new modem apparently doesn't do that. My Wi-Fi router was set to be an access point to avoid conflicts. So all the built-in troubleshooting between the new modem and the Wi-Fi router reset my Wi-Fi router to now assign IP addresses and everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: robertg

customer_reviews.title: Super reliable modem
customer_reviews.text: I only just installed this modem replacing an older version of Motorola modem that was not 3.0... We have had four Motorola modems over the last 20 years and they have all been reliable and trouble free...We are seniors and appreciate simple installation instructions and the Motorola tech support if needed...Dave Murray
customer_reviews.author: David S Murray

customer_reviews.title: Works great wish I had done sooner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Xfinity device. I was easily able to set up without calling support. Connected modem to laptop (didn't have lan port on laptop, so I purchased an USB lan adapter) and typed in Xfinity upgrade web address and followed prompt as other stated. Thought I would lose some performance as this is a lower end device, but didn't notice any. Removing the Xfinity device corrected a problem I had with my poor cell phone reception inside my house.
customer_reviews.author: KAT

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, fast, and simple
customer_reviews.text: I love this modem. It's simple, easy to connect, tiny and displays very easy to understand connection blinkers. It's sort of adorable and quintessential, the way Nokia phones were in 2011. I thought the price seemed fair enough. Much rather keep this with me than pay the Boogie Man $10/month for the rest of my life to lease an oversize modem- router that secretly spreading a darknet of paid-for WiFi hotspot. No thanks! That got kind of dark, but this really is a great modem to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Caravaggio

customer_reviews.title: GREAT/good LED’s on modem
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I will mention AFTER PLUGGING EVERYTHING UP you must CONTACT COMCAST/INTERNET PROVIDER for them to activate it. Just let them know you’d like to activate your modem. They’ll ask for the modem serial number / CM number. Anyway this is perfect the lights aren’t too annoying like other modems that have bad reviews. This is a first impression review if it fails / gives me errors I will update!
customer_reviews.author: Victor H.

customer_reviews.title: If you have cox, call to register the modem. Takes about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Nice modem, easy to set up and the speed was right on, looks nice and not too big. The lights are in green and very easy to see. Great that everything is labeled in the back. If you have cox, after you set it up, you need to call them to register the modem with the serial number. Took about 5 minutes. Just call and ask for internet help. So if you do not get connect right away call your cable company. Once they set the serial number, it started before I hung up the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Big Reader

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 13 Days
customer_reviews.text: Last 13 Days, would not go faster than 30mbs, from 230mbs after 13 days. Smelled burnt, ethernet would not work with pc, router only. Had a Xfinity tech at my house for 2 hours, all other variable were ruled out. Plugged in old modem, no more speed issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ruebarb

customer_reviews.title: Works well with bad signals
customer_reviews.text: Has nice tools for looking at the signal quality of your cable service. It also allows you to change the username and password. I bought to see if it would help with the service problem I was having. When I look at the connection information in the console I see it's producing a very good result from a terribly bad signal with my service.
customer_reviews.author: dwdw3

customer_reviews.title: clear and easy setup process
customer_reviews.text: i have had this for several months now and it has worked perfectly from day one. clear and easy setup process, and it may not seem like a big deal, but it has an actual power on/off button, that matters to me because with previous modems when i had to reset them it had to be unplugged, and more often than not the power cord would fall behind the bookshelf and blah blah. great to have that button and great little device.
customer_reviews.author: Ialwaysresearch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem
customer_reviews.text: Very nice build quality and seems to produce much less heat than previous cablemodems I've had. From what I can see, this modem is designed to stay upright (not flat) so this should be taken into account. Note that this router is marketed by Motorola but MADE by Zoom, so when I was on the phone with my ISP registering the modem, the CSR didn't find the MB7420 under Motorola and thought it wasn't on the approved list. If an ISP doesn't recognize the modem as a Motorola, it might be helpful to mention that it might be listed under Zoom.
customer_reviews.author: BSR

customer_reviews.title: Great Motorola Quality & Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Motorola modem, and all have been great. Power adaptor failed on the second one, but tech support was excellent and a replacement was shipped immediately. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Beach House DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: "Was" a great modem and very simple.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great as soon as I hooked it up and changed the MAC through my ISP. Try a couple of Cheap arris ones, including a surfboard one, and either wouldn't connect to the ISP or ethernet port problems, I guess you get what you pay for. Great Modem. Edit: After about the first month it's in and out. I literally have to disconnect the Cable wire and reconnect and restart the modem. Resetting the modem isn't enough. Also it gets really hot and I wonder if that is what caused it to go bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Works with Apple Time machine capsule
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to install using an Apple time machine capsule as a router. Needed Apple support to tell me to plug the modem into the bottom Ethernet slot on the time machine capsule. The Apple unit also is a back up device so the mid was a cost effective match for my house and keys me send back the cable company combination router modem and save monthly rentals
customer_reviews.author: massazon

customer_reviews.title: Router works great and easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: Started cable service with Xfinity and chose to purchase my own modem rather than rent theirs. I Chose the self install option where they mail you an install package (a piece of coax cable). I was able to have this up and going before the package arrived and was able to do everything online. There is a website that the modem can access to setup everything.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router about 4 years ago and still running strong. Runs a little hot but i improvised by attaching a small fan to the modem controlled by a thermostat to keep the internal temperature at 70 deg. F. It just keeps going and going. No lag between 4 computers (2 wireless laptops), a Smart TV, game console and an Ipad all running at the same time. Thank you Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Technobo

customer_reviews.title: Rebranded modem requires calling Cable customer support to activate.  Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.text: Because Cox detects this as a Zoom MB7420, you'll need to call customer service to activate the modem. Ordinarily with Cox, you'd just plug the modem in, go to a website, and be done in under 5 minutes. Instead, you need to get Cox customer service on the phone, which is a significantly less convenient option and will easily eat up the better part of an hour. It's just not worth the hassle when you can buy a different modem for similar price, features, and easier install.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been All My Life?
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over my last modem. I was using a Motorola Arris SB6141 modem. Reliability has gone up tremendously over the Arris. The size is perfect and I am finally back to a black color. This MB7420 even has an Off/On switch on the back of it conveniently located at the top of the backside. Every modem should have an Off/On switch! I was having to recycle the Arris by unplugging it and then replugging it at least 3 times a week to keep it running. I've had this MB7420 for several weeks and have never had to recycle the power to keep it running.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: One pay's extra for Motorola to have peace of mind. If your internet stops working, you can probably be sure this modem is not your problem. Plugged it in a month ago and it hasn't skipped a beat. My speed did not increase significantly - but it was fast already. I paid the extra $50 for the Motorola name so I wouldn't have to worry about it. Hope I was right. Had to call Sanjay at Comcast for the setup - but no difficulty. He registered it over the phone in 2-3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: El Kati

customer_reviews.title: it just plugged in and worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: My Modem (finally) died and I needed another one, both cheap and fast. I looked 'em up here, and found this one. I just plugged it in (correctly) and it has worked well. The modem it replaced was only (!) about 10-12 years old. I have had thoughts as to whether the modem I got this year would last as long. We'll see. But in any case, it just plugged in and worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hallmark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any issues and think this is a fine modem. I run regular tests and get 190 MB reguarly (considering Xfinity is 175 this is excellent). When Xfinity came to set up my service, they had no issues working with this Motorola modem. I plug in my Google Mesh system right into the modem and away we go. Excellent stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Working Great for 2 Years
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem for two years and the only rare outages I've experienced have been the result of my ISP. This device along with my quality router have consistently given me speeds at or near the amount I pay for. I don't understand the technology well enough to give you an in-depth technical analysis, but I'm overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Spectrum Internet addition
customer_reviews.text: It took spectrum tech on phone about an hour to separate voice from internet on Spectrum modem then set up up internet on Motorola modem. Thankfully the Motorola was on their compatible list. Computer restart after all set up and reliable full speed restored. Half speed was "normal" on Spectrum modem. Now I do not lose voice when rebooting internet.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D Turner

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and constantly needing rebooted
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this device. Motorola used to have decent products - my last modem from them lasted 5 years. This one last a month before I started having issues and by 6 months it won't connect to my ISP any more. Terrible product that I wish I could return. Waste of money and time troubleshooting
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This modem is amazing. It's only $60 but I've never had a problem with it. I've been using it 24/7 for the past two years, and I've only had to restart it once or twice a year. It's rock-solid and just doesn't stop working. Works perfectly with Comcast Xfinity. If you're looking for an inexpensive yet reliable modem, this is the one! Note: this is a modem ONLY. It doesn't not broadcast wifi or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Works with comcast!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me. Already saved $100 in not paying the modem rental fee from xfinity. Only have cable & internet but if you have phone service from comcast, then you'll need a different modem.
customer_reviews.author: SKo

customer_reviews.title: Do no buy a open box modem!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy a Open box modem!! I thought I’d save a few dollars but ended up wasting a lot of time the modem I received was still actively linked to a out of region account so they can’t link it to my new service, going on day 3 with no internet after my install day well they try to contact the other provider
customer_reviews.author: Semper fi

customer_reviews.title: Divine--instant success and completely reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Bliss. It worked with no problems after I called Cox and gave them the numbers they needed to set it up. For reasons I do not understand, the ARRIS SURFboard SB6183 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem I bought initially, which was installed by an on-site Cox tech, worked intermittently, only about 30% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: ReadToLive

customer_reviews.title: Solid & Dependable Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Can't ask for much more: since purchasing and setting up this cable modem, things have been humming along nicely. No drops, no speed issues, no issues at all. Very happy with this purchase--it just works (and continues to work) without any issues. Being someone who is constantly playing around with tech hardware (I'm in emerging technology), I appreciate equipment that competently and effortlessly does its job...and that I don't have to constantly fiddle with to get it to perform as advertised. Recommended if you want to buy your own cable modem instead of paying the cable company their ridiculous monthly fees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: MOTOROLA 16x4 Cable Modem, Model MB7420, 686 Mbps DOCSIS 3.0, Certified by Comcast XFINITY, Charter Spectrum, Time Warner Cable, Cox, BrightHouse, and More
feature_bullets: This 16x4 DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem provides speeds up to 686 Mbps, sixteen times faster than DOCSIS 2.0. A Full-Band Capture digital tuner ensures a faster, more reliable Internet.

Cable modem's Ethernet port connects to a computer, HDTV, game station, or wireless router. (This Model MB7420 cable modem does NOT have a built-in wireless router and does NOT have a telephone adapter or phone jack. The Motorola MG7310, MG7315, MG7540 and MG7550 have a built-in wireless router.)

Requires cable Internet service. Certified by Comcast XFINITY for residential speeds up to Extreme 300, by Comcast Business for speeds up to Deluxe 250, Time Warner Cable, Cox, Charter Spectrum, BrightHouse, and other leading cable service providers for modem ownership programs that typically save rental charges of $120 or more per year
Setup is fast and easy with a few quick steps set out in a Quick Start guide. Experienced USA-based customer support specialists are there to help if you need them.

Attractive, compact design minimizes shelf space, improves cooling, and extends product life while looking great in any home or office. A two-year warranty plus rugged lightning and power surge circuits protect your investment.
